item.title: Ticket #3280 (Addition of an "Auto Line Breaks" toggle.) updated
item.dc:creator: bryanveloso
item.description:
Owner changed

Assigned to Mark, because I adore him so. :]

item.title: Ticket #3280 (Addition of an "Auto Line Breaks" toggle.) created
item.dc:creator: bryanveloso
item.description:
User reports wanting to put HTML in a post, only to see that line breaks are placed after tags, naturally, because each of those lines do have line breaks after them. Proposal to add a check box that will allow users to disable the auto-paragraph and line break option on a per case basis.

I realize this is an edge case, but it could prove useful. I thought this already existed, but maybe it's one of my many hallucinations. :]

item.title: Ticket #3279 (Theme doesn't load properly when theme directory name contains a '+' sign) updated
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
Version, Milestone changed

I don't have the problem here on 4419. Instead, I am just unable to activate the theme as the activate URL is incorrect: 

http://localhost/wordpress-latest/wp-admin/themes.php?action=activate&template=clas%20sic&stylesheet=clas%20sic&_wpnonce=506392aeae
<a href="themes.php?action=activate&template=clas sic&stylesheet=clas sic&_wpnonce=506392aeae" class="screenshot">

The plus sign gets turned into a space.

item.title: Ticket #3279 (Theme doesn't load properly when theme directory name contains a '+' sign) created
item.dc:creator: ming
item.description:
A theme directory that contains the '+' symbol causes WP to choke on the directory name. Once activated WP can no longer access the theme directory so the site is blank (view source is completely empty).

The 'current theme' section contains no information: ie "All of this theme’s files are located in ."

I haven't checked other symbols besides the plus sign

Using WAMP development server on WinXP WP version 2.1-alpha3 nightly build (oct 22?)

item.title: Ticket #3277 (WYSIWYG editor not work with squid/2.5.STABLE9 proxy) created
item.dc:creator: tomash
item.description:
I'm using same laptop at work and at home. I login to the same WordPress instance. At home I have direct DSL internet connection, at work my network configuration forces me to use proxy server with squid (squid/2.5.STABLE9) installed.

At home wysiwyg editor works great. Then at work, without any other changes, it fails with errors on javascript console: 

Błąd: sack is not defined
Plik źródłowy: http://poleska.dreamhosters.com/wp-admin/cat-js.php
Wiersz: 1
Błąd: edToolbar is not defined
Plik źródłowy: http://poleska.dreamhosters.com/wp-admin/post.php
Wiersz: 164
Błąd: tinyMCE is not defined
Plik źródłowy: http://poleska.dreamhosters.com/wp-admin/post.php
Wiersz: 174
Błąd: dbxManager is not defined
Plik źródłowy: http://poleska.dreamhosters.com/wp-admin/post.php
Wiersz: 18
Błąd: Nieznana własność "filter".  Deklaracja opuszczona.
Plik źródłowy: http://poleska.dreamhosters.com/wp-admin/inline-uploading.php?post=-1161691353&action=upload
Wiersz: 291

All plugins are disabled in wp vanilla installation. Bug affects both IE and Firefox, before and after cleaning cache, removing cookies, forcing refresh by f5/ctrl-f5 and so on.

item.title: Ticket #3275 (Post and edit Pages to future) updated
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description: I meant to write passionate not patient.

item.title: Ticket #3275 (Post and edit Pages to future) closed
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description:
invalid:

Closing as INVALID.

Hi Akatemik, thank you for contributing to WordPress development.

It is best to write in terms of the problem before suggestion solutions.

It is best not to include two issues in a single ticket: (1) writing pages for the future (2) time based versioning (not sure if that describes what you are looking for) The problems you are trying to solve do not seem to apply to most people using WordPress. If this is something you are patient about I suggest writing a plugin for this.

item.title: Ticket #3275 (Post and edit Pages to future) created
item.dc:creator: Akatemik
item.description:
Being able to write Pages in advance and have them automaticly published would be great. Even more great would be able to edit Pages so that the new version will have a timer. This is not really valid to posts, since they are more time dependant anyway, but information on pages might change with time.

​http://trac.wordpress.org/ticket/1820 solves the initial publishing, but since the current system has no timed editing, something new needs to be added.

item.title: Ticket #3246 (make menu items in menu-headers.php relative) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Only potential downside I can see is that it wouldn't work if there was a WP admin page in a subdirectory of /wp-admin/

Can we think of any case where that would happen? I've certainly never seen it.

item.title: patch.diff attached to Ticket #3274
item.dc:creator: alexkingorg
item.description: patch

item.title: Ticket #3274 ("Limit Posts to Category" breaks paging) created
item.dc:creator: alexkingorg
item.description:
Using a plugin similar to Ryan Boren's Front Page Cats ​http://dev.wp-plugins.org/browser/front-page-cats is breaking paging.

The problem is in _max_num_pages() - the $wpdb->get_var("SELECT COUNT... fails with the JOIN.

I've attached a patch, but I'm not crazy about the solution. However, since the query hooks allow this sort of join and there are no hooks in max_num_pages or the paging functions, it seems like a better solution that what we have now.

item.title: Ticket #3270 (Only CSS file show up in theme editor) closed
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description:
worksforme:

dtc, thank you for participating in WP! We need a lot more detail to investigate such an issue including platform information

Closing bug WORKSFORME

ENV: WP 2.0.4+ r4415
WP trunk r4415

In Theme Editor with theme WordPress default selected, I see in the list searchform.php and many other php files. I am able to select them and view the file's contents.

dtc please "Also include information about your platform, such as operating system, web server softrware, PHP version, MySQL version etc."
​http://codex.wordpress.org/Reporting_Bugs#Reporting_your_bug

Additionally, I wonder how a general problem like this could go unreported? As that is very unlikely, I would consider searching further here and at ​http://wordpress.org/support to look for clues, and if nothing is found seek help at ​http://wordpress.org/support
